1.text: The parables of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel.

2.text: To know wisdom, and instruction: To understand the words of prudence:

3.text: and to receive the instruction of doctrine, justice, and judgment, and equity:

4.text: To give subtilty to little ones, to the young man knowledge and understanding.

5.text: A wise man shall hear and shall be wiser: and he that understandeth, shall possess governments.

6.text: He shall understand a parable, and the interpretation, the words of the wise, and their mysterious sayings.

7.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. Fools despise wisdom and instruction.

8.text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother :

9.text: That grace may be added to thy head, and a chain of gold to thy neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners shall entice thee, consent not to them.

11.text: If they shall say: Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood, let us hide snares for the innocent without cause:

12.text: Let us swallow him up alive like hell, and whole as one that goeth down into the pit.

13.text: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoils.

14.text: Cast in thy lot with us, let us all have one purse.

15.text: My son, walk not thou with them, restrain thy foot from their paths.

16.text: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

17.text: But a net is spread in vain before the eyes of them that have wings.

18.text: And they themselves lie in wait for their own blood, and practise deceits against their own souls.

19.text: So the wage of every covetous man destroy the souls of the possessors.

20.text: Wisdom preacheth abroad, she uttereth her voice in the streets:

21.text: At the head of multitudes she crieth out, in the entrance of the gates of the city she uttereth her words, saying:

22.text: O children, how long will you love childishness, and fools covet those things which are hurtful to themselves, and the unwise hate knowledge?

23.text: Turn ye at my reproof: behold I will utter my spirit to you, and will shew you my words.

24.text: Because I called, and you refused: I stretched out my hand, and there was none that regarded.

25.text: You have despised all my counsel, and have neglected my reprehensions.

26.text: I also will laugh in your destruction, and will mock when that shall come to you which you feared.

27.text: When sudden calamity shall fall on you, and destruction, as a tempest, shall be at hand: when tribulation and distress shall come upon you:

28.text: Then shall they call upon me, and I will not hear: they shall rise in the morning and shall not find me:

29.text: Because they have hated instruction and received not the fear of the Lord,

30.text: Nor consented to my counsel, but despised all my reproof.

31.text: Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own way, and shall be filled with their own devices.

32.text: The turning away of little ones shall kill them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

33.text: But he that shall hear me, shall rest without terror, and shall enjoy abundance, without fear of evils.
